name: Artichokes
properties: Extremely high in antioxidants (among highest of all vegetables)
Rich in cynarin and silymarin compounds
Contains folate, vitamin C, and vitamin K
Provides minerals including magnesium and potassium
Low in calories, high in nutrients
benefits: Promotes digestive health with high fiber and prebiotics
Aids in bile production and fat digestion
Promotes gut microbiome health with inulin
Helps with satiety and weight management
synergies: Pairs well with spinach in stuffed dishes
Combines with white beans for enhanced nutrition
Works with cannellini beans in paella dishes
amount: 1 medium artichoke or Â½ to 1 cup (400g tin) artichoke hearts per serving

quotes: ARTICHOKE AND SPINACH STUFFED PORTOBELLOS - MAKES: 2 to 4 servings DIFFICULTY: Easy

If you like artichoke dip, a perennial favourite, you'll love this healthier and more flavour-packed version that we stuff into meaty portobellos. 1 (400g) BPA-free tin or Tetra Pak salt-free artichoke hearts, drained, or 1 (10-ounce/300g) package frozen artichokes, cooked and cooled
1 (400g) BPA-free tin artichoke hearts, drained and quartered
Artichokes, ref1, ref2 - Artichoke and Spinach Stuffed Portobellos
